title: How to Make Simple Molded Truffles

steps.headline: Melt your coating or chocolate.
steps.description: Put in a a microwave safe bowl. Microwave at thirty-second intervals, stirring in between. Stir until smooth.

steps.headline: Spoon your coating into the mold.
steps.description: It should fill it about halfway.

steps.headline: Coat the inside of the mold with the coating or chocolate using your brush.
Check the mold.
steps.description: Lift it above you so you can see the bottom. If you can see anything but the coating, use your brush to cover the hole with coating. Remember, if the shell isn't completely covered, the filling can fall out.

steps.headline: Put it in the fridge until the coating has hardened; at least ten minutes.
Fill the molds with your filling.
steps.description: Use a spoon to scoop the filling into the molds. Pat it down so it will fill the mold. Leave a little bit of space on the top.

steps.headline: Put a dollop of the coating above your filling and spread it around with your brush until it completely covers it.
Put it in the fridge for about ten minutes, or until it hardens.
Pop them out of your mold and enjoy!

text: Gather ingredients and supplies. See "Ingredients" and "Things You'll Need". Melt your coating or chocolate. Put in a a microwave safe bowl. Microwave at thirty-second intervals, stirring in between. Stir until smooth. Spoon your coating into the mold. It should fill it about halfway. Coat the inside of the mold with the coating or chocolate using your brush.  Check the mold. Lift it above you so you can see the bottom. If you can see anything but the coating, use your brush to cover the hole with coating. Remember, if the shell isn't completely covered, the filling can fall out. Put it in the fridge until the coating has hardened; at least ten minutes.  Fill the molds with your filling. Use a spoon to scoop the filling into the molds. Pat it down so it will fill the mold. Leave a little bit of space on the top. Put a dollop of the coating above your filling and spread it around with your brush until it completely covers it.  Put it in the fridge for about ten minutes, or until it hardens.  Pop them out of your mold and enjoy!
